## **Reasearch Question:** 
What song features play a significant role in a song's popularity?

## **Plan:**
1. Model selection, variable selection

## **Description of the data**
The data consists of 174389 songs with 19 features described below. 

### **Primary:**
* id (Id of track generated by Spotify)

### **Numerical variables:**
<div class="col2">
* acousticness (Ranges from 0 to 1)
* danceability (Ranges from 0 to 1)
* energy (Ranges from 0 to 1)
* duration_ms (Integer typically ranging from 200k to 300k)
* instrumentalness (Ranges from 0 to 1)
* valence (Ranges from 0 to 1)
* popularity (Ranges from 0 to 100)
* tempo (Float typically ranging from 50 to 150)
* liveness (Ranges from 0 to 1)
* loudness (Float typically ranging from -60 to 0)
* speechiness (Ranges from 0 to 1)
* year (Ranges from 1921 to 2020)
</div>

### **Categorical variables:**
* mode (0 = Minor, 1 = Major)
* explicit (0 = No explicit content, 1 = Explicit content)
* key (All keys on octave encoded as values ranging from 0 to 11, starting on C as 0, C# as 1 and so onâ€¦)
* artists (List of artists mentioned)
* release_date (Date of release mostly in yyyy-mm-dd format, however precision of date may vary)
* name (Name of the song)

## **Data processing:**
* Removed the id, artists and name of tracks
* Created a new categorical variable, *season*, based on the release date, and removed the variable release_date  
* Converted the categorical variables to factor
* Created a binary response, pop_binary, from popularity; 0 if popularity$<50$, 1 otherwise.
